Applications of Barrel Plating

Barrel plating plants are beneficial for:

  • Components that are small to medium sized and not very complex in construction
  • Fasteners
  • Hardware
  • Electrical components

Why choose us?

  • The ability to handle a variety of finishes with a variety of components within same production facility
  • US Automation’ Enhanced Automation
  • Material Handling System of the Future
  • Integrated Fume Extraction System with PLC Control
  • Man and machine safety features are extensive.
  • Design that is extremely easy to maintain
  • Designed to help you save money on water.
  • Availability of Automatic, Semi-Automatic, and Manual Plants

Why Automation is Preferred in Plating?

In bulk plating operations, automation is strongly recommended for the following reasons:

  • Consistency
  • Lower Labor costs
  • Eradication of Human errors
  • Reduced Operating costs
  • Controlled Inputs
  • Better Production Control
  • Traceability and Versatility

How Automation in Plating Works at US Automation?

  • Requirement based Loading
  • Process Driven Auto Controlled Current and Temperature
  • Automatic conductivity and level control
  • Auto-dosing based on ampere-hour consumption/processed area
  • Production and Data Recording for Events and Alarms
  • Process Monitoring through the Internet
  • SMS/Email notification of an event
  • Voice Activation
  • Parts identification with a bar scanner

excerpt.rendered:
US Automation develops, designs, manufactures, delivers, and installs top-of-the-line BARREL plating machines for a variety of applications.

For bulk processing of small to medium sized components, barrel plating is extensively used. Components are placed in an instrument known as the Barrel during the finishing process. The barrel is then passed through a series of chemical treatments to finish the surface finish. The dangler, an electrical contact in these barrels, aids in the passage of DC current.

The size, form, and weight of the items available for barrel plating limit the options available. Barrels are normally made out of a non-conductive material. Perforations in the barrel body aid in achieving a uniform polish on the components.

The Cherry on the Top, our plants are highly customizable based on client’s request and requirements.
